recipe_name: Baked apple with cinnamon butterscotch sauce
author: Brian Turner
method: Preheat the oven to 200C/400F/Gas 6. For the baked apple, melt the butter in a small ovenproof frying pan. Add the apple, flesh-side down, and fry for two minutes. Turn the apple over, sprinkle with the cinnamon and sugar, then transfer to the oven to bake for 10-12 minutes, until softened and cooked through. To make the sauce, place the sugar, cinnamon and butter into a frying pan and heat for 3-4 minutes to caramelise. Add the double cream and continue to heat to thicken the sauce. To serve, place the baked apple in the centre of a warm plate and pour over the butterscotch cinnamon sauce.
ingredients: 50g/1¾oz unsalted butter,  ½ apple, core removed,  1 tbsp cinnamon,  1 tbsp brown sugar,  2 tbsp brown sugar,  ½ tbsp cinnamon,  50g/1¾oz unsalted butter,  50ml/2fl oz double cream
